post_title: WARNING: Your email account will be deactivated soon 4/21/2021 2:59:52 p.m.
post_text:
blogger.com    Server Warning!

 

Dear  horsema030.1004,  

We noticed you have ignored the previous server warnings about updating your account, this will be the final warning because we are de-activating every email account that has not been updated.

If you want to continue using this email account , kindly click on the link below to verify your account.

   Click here to Verify or update your account

NOTE: If you fail to verify your account  horsema030.1004@blogger.com, your account will be deactivated permanently.

 blogger.com   Administrator

post_title: Original XBox with owners again upgrading
post_text:
So, you could ask for a refund, but since there's no actual refund policy, you're not going to get one.  All of these companies are located off-shore. There is not one gold selling company located within the borders of the United States.  If you do not receive the purchased gold you would have to dispute the charge on your credit card; but, this would mean that you have to prove the gold was never delivered, and that means getting Blizzard getting involved - which means you're going to lose your account.

Playstation 3, as is the original XBox with owners again upgrading. Don't always expect a lot of games as many sellers will keep a lot of their games to use on their newer consoles but you should still be able to grab a bargain or two. Games for both are still easy to pick up on the high street at knock-down prices so they're still worth thinking about.

With each newspaper there is a supplement that has a list of the venues and timings of the upcoming parties. Details of the next pin are also available.  There is even an advice column in the newspaper. The penguin writing them is called Aunt Arctic. She lets people answers people queries regarding games and even manners. If a resident has a question, it is answered in the newspaper through this column using the pen name of Aunt Arctic.

DOOM into tiny pieces or fighting the Nazi?s in France while playing Call of Duty or pretending to be Mario Andretti flying down the Monaco Speedway. Games have become so realistic that we are made to feel as though we are in the game and not merely just playing them.   As a gamer I can honestly say that has been one thing missing. Realism. Sure ? I have been talking about realistic things like graphics being realistic and characters being realistic. Even large worlds created by programmers for people like us to play around in are sort of realistic.   But realism, ah ? that is the real holy grail of gaming.
